Given the governor's order to suspend in-person instruction for the remainder of this school year, we understand that many students may have left items in lockers that they need to retrieve. The new Illinois stay-at-home order issued April 23 allows schools to establish procedures for retrieval of student belongings using social distancing practices. Below please find information about the process for New Trier students to sign up to retrieve their items, safety guidelines students must follow including wearing a mask while on campus, and information regarding dropping off items that belong to the school district.

Each student will schedule an appointment to retrieve items from their hallway locker and KW/Athletic lockers. All items must be picked up by the last day indicated for each campus below. Items not retrieved will be donated or properly disposed of. The schedule for each campus is below:

ul.li: Mondays: 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. and 1 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.
Mondays: 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. and 1 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

div.p: Only students who have signed up will be admitted on campus. To sign up please complete the appropriate campus sign-up sheet by clicking on the link below.

li.a: Northfield Campus Locker Clean Out Sign-Up
Winnetka Campus Locker Clean Out Sign-Up

div.p: New Trier has taken steps to ensure social and physical distancing is possible in our buildings and to ensure the safety of students and staff:

ul.li: We are limiting the number of students allowed inside campus at any given time
Security staff have been assigned to monitor social and physical distancing
Floor distancing markers and added signage will be posted to remind students of the guidelines
Both campuses have been extensively deep cleaned and we will take additional sanitation action to disinfect high-traffic and high-touch areas

div.p: When on campus, students will be required to maintain a safe social distance even if lockers are in the same area. When students approach campus they will be asked to wait following social distancing markings on the sidewalk outside of their entry point. Winnetka Campus students will line up and enter the North (glass) entrance off Trevian Way. Northfield Campus students will line up and enter from the west gate located between the D and E Buildings off Happ Road.

Students must wear face masks. We will not have face masks available, and students without them cannot enter the buildings. We also suggest that students bring their own bags or boxes so they can carry all items out of the buildings on their own. We will not have bags available.

Given these distancing and safety measures, we ask that only students come during their assigned times. Family members should not come along. If a student cannot pick up their own items, please complete this form to request your items be retrieved for you and delivered to your home. Please note, this option may take up to three weeks for delivery.

ol.li: Students arrive at the North Entrance at Winnetka campus or D/E Gate at Northfield campus 5 minutes prior to their assigned time .

Expect to wait outside in marked spaces that are at least 6 feet apart along the sidewalk. Only the designated student should come at their appointed time. Family members, friends, etc. are not allowed to wait with students or enter the buildings.
Staff will direct students when to enter.
Students are required to wear a mask to enter the building. Please bring one from home.

Once students have emptied their locker they should leave the locker door open and immediately head to the exit. Students will not be allowed to congregate in the buildings or anywhere else on campus including parking lots.

Winnetka Campus students will return to the North entrance and exit the building from the opposite set of doors, which allow separation from the students entering. Northfield Campus students will exit campus from the Athletic gate located between the F and D buildings.

b.u: Returning School Items and Project Retrieval

div.p: Library Book Return - On your assigned day there will be tables available outside the cafeteria doors where you can place your library books for return. All late fees incurred due to school closure will be waived.

Art Supply Return and Project Pick Up - On your assigned day there will be tables outside the cafeteria doors where you can place your Art supplies for return (cameras, tripods, etc…). All equipment must be returned by May 15. Art students will be able to retrieve their project items from art storage spaces. Please contact your teacher to find out where your art is being stored.
Applied Art Project Pick Up - Students in Applied Art classes will be able to retrieve their project items from the mobile project carts located in the Applied Art hallway.
Athletic Equipment Return - Students who need to return equipment will be contacted by the Athletic Department with specific information regarding athletic equipment return.

Performing Arts Item Return - Students who need to return instruments, tuxedos, other formal wear and Performing Arts items will be contacted by the department with specific information regarding the time and place for return.
iPad and other technology returns will take place towards the end of the 4th quarter. More information about returning loaned technology equipment will be sent to students by mid-May.
Medicine and equipment in Health Services - Students who store medicine and equipment in the Health Services office will be contacted by the school nurse to coordinate returning those items to you.
